intro: Ranunculus dissectus subsp. ermenekensis, commonly known as the Ermenek dissected buttercup, is a rare and endemic species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, dissected leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, palmately lobed leaves and produces numerous flowers with five sepals and numerous stamens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
